alert.note: Alert for Crawford (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 05 at 12:20AM CDT until May 05 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR CRAWFORD COUNTY... At 1220 AM CDT, Trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area and ongoing flash flooding. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pittsburg, Girard, Frontenac, Arma, Cherokee, Mulberry, Mccune and Arcadia. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
